revision.text:
{{Infobox person | caption = Enrico Colantoni at the 2013 Comic Con | image = Enrico Colantoni by Gage Skidmore.jpg | image_size = 220px | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1963|2|14}} | birth_place = [[Toronto]], [[Ontario]], Canada | nationality = [[Canadians|Canadian]] | occupation = Actor | yearsactive = 1987–present | spouse = {{marriage|Nancy Snyder|1997|2004|reason=divorced}}
{{marriage|Rosanna Francioni|2011}} | children = 2 }} '''Enrico Colantoni''' (born February 14, 1963) is a Canadian actor and Director, best known for portraying Elliot DiMauro in the sitcom ''[[Just Shoot Me!]]'', [[Keith Mars]] on the television series ''[[Veronica Mars]]'', and Sergeant Greg Parker on the television series ''[[Flashpoint (TV Series)|Flashpoint]]''. He has also had supporting roles in such films as ''[[The Wrong Guy]]'', ''[[Galaxy Quest]]'', ''[[A.I. Artificial Intelligence]]'', and ''[[Contagion (film)|Contagion]]'', and guest appearances on ''[[Monk (TV series)|Monk]]'', ''[[Numbers (TV series)|Numb3rs]]'', ''[[Party Down]]'', ''[[Stargate SG-1]]'', and ''[[Bones (TV series)|Bones]]''. More recently, he starred as Allen Conner in ''[[Remedy (TV series)|Remedy]]'', and played crime boss Carl Elias in a recurring role on ''[[Person of Interest (TV series)|Person of Interest]]''. He played Laura Hollis' father in season three of the online web series ''[[Carmilla (series)|Carmilla]]''. He most recently appeared as Vincent Ingram in ''[[Travelers (TV series)|Travelers]]''. Colantoni Directed two episodes of the TV show ''[[iZombie (TV series)|iZombie]]''. ==Early life== Colantoni was born in [[Toronto]], [[Ontario]], the son of Gina, a garment worker, and Quintino Colantoni, a labourer and truck driver.[http://www.filmreference.com/film/26/Enrico-Colantoni.html "Enrico Colantoni Biography (1963-)"]. Film Reference. Retrieved April 18, 2015. Both his parents were immigrants from [[Italy]], and his brother, Det. Sgt. Hector Colantoni, is a retired police officer with the [[Toronto Police Service]].{{cite news|author=Kalanderopoulos, Christopher|title=Asking for Help|url=http://www.eggplante.com/2011/02/23/asking-for-help/|newspaper=Eggplante!|date=February 23, 2011}} He attended the [[University of Toronto]] studying psychology and sociology, but transferred to the [[American Academy of Dramatic Arts]] in [[New York City]]. Colantoni graduated from the [[Yale School of Drama]], winning the Carol Dye Award.{{cite news| url=https://movies.nytimes.com/person/271316/Enrico-Colantoni/biography| work=[[The New York Times]]|title=Enrico Colantoni|accessdate=April 18, 2015}}{{cite news| url=https://www.thestar.com/entertainment/2008/07/10/flashpoint_star_brings_work_home_to_toronto.html |title=Flashpoint star brings work home to Toronto|work=[[Toronto Star]]|first1=Bruce|last1=DeMara|date=10 July 2008}} ==Career== [[File:Enrico Colantoni 2007.jpg|thumb|Colantoni during a TV interview in 2008]] Colantoni starred in the TV series ''[[Remedy (TV series)|Remedy]]''. He appeared in the Canadian TV police drama ''[[Flashpoint (TV series)|Flashpoint]]'' as Sgt. Greg ParkerWilford, Denette (September 20, 2012). [http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2012/09/20/flashpoint-season-5-enrico-colantoni-interview_n_1900894.html {{"'}}Flashpoint' Season 5: Enrico Colantoni Talks Show's Ending and the 'Veronica Mars' Movie"]. ''[[The Huffington Post]]''Zier, Vogel, Lindsay (September 27, 2012). [http://www.ctv.ca/FlashPoint/article/Enrico-Colantoni-reflects-on-Sgt-Greg-Parkers-intense-Flashpoint-journey "Enrico Colantoni reflects on Sgt. Greg Parker's intense 'Flashpoint' journey"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150419053841/http://www.ctv.ca/FlashPoint/article/Enrico-Colantoni-reflects-on-Sgt-Greg-Parkers-intense-Flashpoint-journey |date=2015-04-19 }} [[CTV Television Network|CTV]]. (also airing in the U.S. on [[ION Television]], and airing previously on [[CBS]]). His older brother, who was a [[Toronto Police Service|Toronto policeman]] for the past 30 years, advised Colantoni on how to play the character.[http://www.ctv.ca/FlashPoint/article/Real-life-cops-grateful-for-portrayal-on-Flashpoint-says-star-Colantoni "Real-life cops grateful for portrayal on 'Flashpoint,' says star Colantoni"] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150419054107/http://www.ctv.ca/FlashPoint/article/Real-life-cops-grateful-for-portrayal-on-Flashpoint-says-star-Colantoni |date=2015-04-19 }}. CTV. August 4, 2010 Colantoni also had a recurring role on ''[[Person of Interest (TV series)|Person of Interest]]'' as crime boss Carl EliasSchwartz, Terri (November 25, 2014). [http://www.zap2it.com/blogs/enrico_colantoni_person_of_interest_season_4_elias_episode-2014-11 "Enrico Colantoni is grateful 'Person of Interest's' writers haven't killed Elias off"]. [[Zap2it]]. and on ''[[Travelers (TV series)|Travelers]]'' as Vincent Ingram (Traveller 001). ==Philanthropy== Since 2011, Colantoni has been heavily involved with The Tema Conter Memorial Trust, an organization that assists first responders and other service personnel deal with [[post-traumatic stress disorder]]. He became their official spokesperson and has been involved in their annual tribute gala in [[Toronto]] every year since. He has also been involved in the Companion Animal Protection Society's campaign to boycott commercial pet stores, creating a video to raise awareness about the topic.[http://www.caps-web.org/news-and-headlines/item/499-caps-psa-with-enrico-colantoni "CAPS PSA with Enrico Colantoni "]. Companion Animal Protection Society. December 21, 2011. ==Personal life== On November 11, 2011, Colantoni married his fiancée, Rosanna Francioni.{{Cite tweet|last=Colantoni |first=Enrico |user=ricocolantoni |number=139738182756474881 |date=November 24, 2011 |title=Rosanna and I got married on 11/11/11. Hugh Dillon and his wife were the witnesses. It was quiet and beautiful.
